<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/us-dept-justice-files-landmark-antitrust-case-google?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google Gets Lawyered
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Google logo in a spotlight" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODQ1L2dvb2dsZV9zcG90bGlnaHQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the U.S. Department of Justice plus 11 state attorneys general <a href="https://apnews.com/article/google-justice-department-antitrust-0510e8f9047956254455ec5d4db06044?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> an antitrust lawsuit against Google and every single one of its nap pods. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is big.</strong> The U.S. government hasn't brought an antitrust case of this size since it tried to chop up Microsoft in 1998.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The government's case</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The DOJ says Google abused its market power to stifle competition. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Remember, it's </span><span><em>not</em></span><span> illegal to be a monopoly in the U.S.—otherwise, why would we have a board game celebrating them? What </span><span><em>is</em></span><span> illegal is using that market dominance to box out rivals. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The DOJ argues that Google </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-20/google-accused-by-u-s-of-abusing-market-power-in-landmark-case?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">illegally used contracts</a></span><span> to ensure its search engine was the default option pre-loaded on cell phones, including Apple's iPhones and its own Androids, blocking competitors. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The response from Mountain View:</strong> Google said in a <a href="https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/public-policy/response-doj?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a> that the DOJ's case is "deeply flawed" and, if successful, would hike up phone prices and force inferior search products onto consumers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it all means: </strong>If you're an antitrust hawk or someone Sundar Pichai once cut off in traffic, you may be getting tingly. But Google potentially getting cut down to size just isn't going to happen anytime soon. This case will likely take more than a year to go to trial—if it isn't settled before then. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Experts also </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tech-antitrust-google-consumers-analy/analysis-what-monopoly-case-doj-lawsuit-unlikely-to-knock-google-from-pole-position-idUSKBN27529N?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">say</a></span><span> we could be in for an outcome similar to what happened in the EU: antitrust case opened → heavy fines levied → Google continues to dominate. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, this is just one front in a broader U.S. v. Google scuffle. Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, for one, is crossing the t's on a complaint about Google's commanding presence in the digital advertising market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>It's unclear whether or not this lawsuit is the beginning of the end of Google as we know it, but it's a historic day for the U.S. government's relationship to big business. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ <strong style="color:#000">Learn more: </strong>There's no better time to refresh your knowledge of Big Tech's recent tangle with lawmakers. Check out the Brew's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/monopoly-aint-just-board-game-brew-explains-antitrust?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guide to antitrust</a> and our piece on <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/23/googles-antitrust-issues-not-just-search?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/white-house-democrats-continue-stimulus-negotiations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Deadline?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/coronavirus-stimulus-update-pelosi-says-relief-deal-with-mnuchin-getting-closer.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continued stimulus negotiations</a> with the White House. Yes, they've been doing that since July, but yesterday was special because: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was exactly two weeks from Election Day. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was the deadline Pelosi set last weekend for a stimulus deal before Election Day.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as we learned in college, deadlines can be flexible if you just ask. Pelosi said lawmakers needed to get "terms on the table" and can finish the bill later this week. White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows said "big differences" remain, but an agreement could arrive before you hit the pumpkin patches this weekend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Those differences? </strong>After working through details around national Covid testing, remaining hang-ups include aid for state/local governments, business liability protections, and total price tag.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday, Trump said he wants to </span><span><a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/trump-says-he-wants-a-bigger-relief-package-than-democrats-2-2t-proposal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go bigger</a></span><span> than Democrats' $2.2 trillion proposal, but GOP lawmakers are still averse to four-comma price tags. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell did say that if the House passes an agreement, he'll put it to a vote "at some point"...but carefully avoided a hard commitment before Nov. 3.</p>

ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/netflix-posts-tepid-q3-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Netflix to Q3 Expectations
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Woman saying "I just miss you"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/mmSy5RrP8HtDi/giphy.gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Woman saying "I just miss you"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/mmSy5RrP8HtDi/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can probably guess how Netflix's <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/netflix-nflx-earnings-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Q3 earnings</a> went based on your own 2020 experience. Starting in March, you spent more time with the streaming service than with your closest friends, but by July, you started to figure out quar life without Jim Halpert and Dustin Henderson. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix lost momentum last quarter, <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/netflix-reports-q3-earnings-2020-streaming-subscribers-pandemic-coronavirus-200208655.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missing</a> Wall Street expectations on earnings as well as subscriber additions. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Analysts had targeted 3.3 million new paying subscribers. Netflix only brought in 2.2 million. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Netflix did eke out a beat on revenue, raking in $6.44 billion versus an expected $6.39 billion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Those so-so numbers <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/netflix-q3-earnings-preview-streaming-competition-subscriber-growth-revenue-cuties-2020-10-1029698265?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">may be</a> the result of controversy over Netflix original <em>Cuties</em>, which conservative critics said promoted child exploitation. Competition from Disney+, NBCUniversal's Peacock, and live sports could also have rained on Netflix's parade. But the company may bounce back in Q4, with winter approaching and rising Covid-19 infections pushing us all back into our living rooms. </p>

</table>
<img alt="A rendering of GMC's Hummer EV in a forest" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODQ3L2h1bW1lcl9ldi5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>GMC</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starting next year, if your friends roll up in a new Hummer, they can skip the guilt screening of <em>An</em> <em>Inconvenient Truth</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">GM <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/20/21525290/hummer-ev-electric-truck-gmc-price-specs-range?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> the new electric Hummer last night, which features a 350+ mile range, "crab mode" for diagonal off-road movement, driver-assist software, and a digital cockpit system designed with <em>Fortnite </em>creator Epic Games.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Under the GMC brand, GM will pump these out at its Detroit-Hamtramck plant, recently <a href="https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/gm-detroit-hamtramck-factory-zero-hummer-ev/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">renamed</a> "Factory Zero." Once the site of the original Dodge factory, it's now the cornerstone of GM's zero-emission, zero-crash, zero-congestion roadmap. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1 down, many to go</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By 2023, GM plans to unveil at least 20 electric vehicles. To get there, it's <a href="https://apnews.com/article/technology-michigan-detroit-tennessee-electric-vehicles-d28dd426a7560d6395e7f8dea0dc23fe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set aside</a> $4.5 billion to upgrade factories for EV production, including…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$2.2 billion for Factory Zero, which will also produce the electric Cruise Origin</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$2 billion to reconfigure a Tennessee plant to produce the Cadillac Lyriq</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$300 million for a plant in Orion Township, MI</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The new Hummer is the crown jewel of GM's electric collection. It also gives the legacy automaker a challenger against the upcoming Tesla Cybertruck and the electric Ford F-150.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CONSUMER GOODS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/consumer-goods-companies-benefit-cleaning-supplies-demand?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Hottest Club in Town Is in the Cabinet Beneath Your Sink
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies that make cleaning supplies continue to impress, because whereas before the pandemic people used to hang out, now we just...wipe counters all day. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">P&G, </strong></span><span>the maker of Tide, reported its biggest global sales increase in 15 years last quarter and </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/p-g-raises-full-profit-111152214.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a></span><span> its annual sales forecast.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Reckitt Benckiser, </strong></span><span>a P&G rival that makes Lysol, also revealed a </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/oct/20/durex-sales-uk-covid-lockdown-reckitt-benckiser-condoms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bumper quarter</a></span><span> yesterday. (Interesting note: RB also said sales of its condom brand Durex rebounded in a big way after lockdowns eased). </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The big question: Is nonstop cleaning here to stay?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These execs say yes. P&G CFO Jon Moeller said "there is some stickiness to new habits that are being formed." And the CEO of Albertsons, a major grocery chain, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-20/p-g-albertsons-say-covid-19-shopping-patterns-are-here-to-stay?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a> there was "a lot of steadiness" in shopping patterns.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The pandemic has led to a stunning turnaround for consumer goods companies that were recently considered dinosaurs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F10%2F20%2Fconsumer-goods-companies-benefit-cleaning-supplies-demand" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kanye's Instagram / Toby Howell Photoshop</em></small>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’re probably wondering, “How in the world did Kanye and Elon earn those ultra-comfy Brew joggers?” We’re glad you asked—through the magical power of <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">photoshop</span> referrals.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All <em>you</em> need to snag a pair for yourself is to refer five<em> </em>friends to the Brew this week using your unique referral code.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Quick note:</strong></span><span> It doesn’t matter how many referrals you currently have—you need to refer five </span><span><em>additional </em></span><span>people this week.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also, U.S. only.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Claim your joggers today.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nANTITRUST\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/20/us-dept-justice-files-landmark-antitrust-case-google?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGoogle Gets Lawyered\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Google logo in a spotlight\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODQ1L2dvb2dsZV9zcG90bGlnaHQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the U.S. Department of Justice plus 11 state attorneys general \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/google-justice-department-antitrust-0510e8f9047956254455ec5d4db06044?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled\u003c/a\u003e an antitrust lawsuit against Google and every single one of its nap pods. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis is big.\u003c/strong\u003e The U.S. government hasn't brought an antitrust case of this size since it tried to chop up Microsoft in 1998.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe government's case\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe DOJ says Google abused its market power to stifle competition. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRemember, it's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e illegal to be a monopoly in the U.S.—otherwise, why would we have a board game celebrating them? What \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eis\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e illegal is using that market dominance to box out rivals. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe DOJ argues that Google \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-20/google-accused-by-u-s-of-abusing-market-power-in-landmark-case?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eillegally used contracts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to ensure its search engine was the default option pre-loaded on cell phones, including Apple's iPhones and its own Androids, blocking competitors. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe response from Mountain View:\u003c/strong\u003e Google said in a \u003ca href=\"https://blog.google/outreach-initiatives/public-policy/response-doj?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e that the DOJ's case is \"deeply flawed\" and, if successful, would hike up phone prices and force inferior search products onto consumers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it all means: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you're an antitrust hawk or someone Sundar Pichai once cut off in traffic, you may be getting tingly. But Google potentially getting cut down to size just isn't going to happen anytime soon. This case will likely take more than a year to go to trial—if it isn't settled before then. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eExperts also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tech-antitrust-google-consumers-analy/analysis-what-monopoly-case-doj-lawsuit-unlikely-to-knock-google-from-pole-position-idUSKBN27529N?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esay\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e we could be in for an outcome similar to what happened in the EU: antitrust case opened → heavy fines levied → Google continues to dominate. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, this is just one front in a broader U.S. v. Google scuffle. Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, for one, is crossing the t's on a complaint about Google's commanding presence in the digital advertising market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIt's unclear whether or not this lawsuit is the beginning of the end of Google as we know it, but it's a historic day for the U.S. government's relationship to big business. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLearn more: \u003c/strong\u003eThere's no better time to refresh your knowledge of Big Tech's recent tangle with lawmakers. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/coronavirus-stimulus-update-pelosi-says-relief-deal-with-mnuchin-getting-closer.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinued stimulus negotiations\u003c/a\u003e with the White House. Yes, they've been doing that since July, but yesterday was special because: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt was exactly two weeks from Election Day. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt was the deadline Pelosi set last weekend for a stimulus deal before Election Day.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as we learned in college, deadlines can be flexible if you just ask. Pelosi said lawmakers needed to get \"terms on the table\" and can finish the bill later this week. White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows said \"big differences\" remain, but an agreement could arrive before you hit the pumpkin patches this weekend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThose differences? \u003c/strong\u003eAfter working through details around national Covid testing, remaining hang-ups include aid for state/local governments, business liability protections, and total price tag.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Trump said he wants to style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou can probably guess how Netflix's \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/20/netflix-nflx-earnings-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eQ3 earnings\u003c/a\u003e went based on your own 2020 experience. Starting in March, you spent more time with the streaming service than with your closest friends, but by July, you started to figure out quar life without Jim Halpert and Dustin Henderson. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix lost momentum last quarter, \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/netflix-reports-q3-earnings-2020-streaming-subscribers-pandemic-coronavirus-200208655.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emissing\u003c/a\u003e Wall Street expectations on earnings as well as subscriber additions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnalysts had targeted 3.3 million new paying subscribers. Netflix only brought in 2.2 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNetflix did eke out a beat on revenue, raking in $6.44 billion versus an expected $6.39 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThose so-so numbers \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/netflix-q3-earnings-preview-streaming-competition-subscriber-growth-revenue-cuties-2020-10-1029698265?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emay be\u003c/a\u003e the result of controversy over Netflix original \u003cem\u003eCuties\u003c/em\u003e, which conservative critics said promoted child exploitation. Competition from Disney+, NBCUniversal's Peacock, and live sports could also have rained on Netflix's parade. But the company may bounce back in Q4, with winter approaching and rising Covid-19 infections pushing us all back into our living rooms. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarting next year, if your friends roll up in a new Hummer, they can skip the guilt screening of \u003cem\u003eAn\u003c/em\u003e href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/20/21525290/hummer-ev-electric-truck-gmc-price-specs-range?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e the new electric Hummer last night, which features a 350+ mile range, \"crab mode\" for diagonal off-road movement, style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnder the GMC brand, GM will pump these out at its Detroit-Hamtramck plant, recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/news/gm-detroit-hamtramck-factory-zero-hummer-ev/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erenamed\u003c/a\u003e \"Factory Zero.\" Once the site of the original Dodge factory, it's now the cornerstone of GM's zero-emission, zero-crash, style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy 2023, GM plans to unveil at least 20 electric vehicles. To get there, it's \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/technology-michigan-detroit-tennessee-electric-vehicles-d28dd426a7560d6395e7f8dea0dc23fe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset aside\u003c/a\u003e $4.5 billion to upgrade factories for EV production, including…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$2.2 billion for Factory Zero, which will also produce the electric Cruise Origin\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$2 billion to reconfigure a Tennessee plant to produce the Cadillac Lyriq\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$300 million for a plant in Orion Township, MI\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe new Hummer is the crown jewel of GM's electric collection.
